intro: Acinodendron trinervium, commonly known as the three-veined acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and simple, alternate leaves with three distinct veins. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
